titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Rudolf Gustav Schmieder (1898-1967) was an entomologist, associate professor of biology at the University of Pennsylvania, and a research associate at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. He received his Ph.D. from the University of Pennsylvania in 1927 and taught there until 1967, retiring shortly before his death. He was active in the American Entomological Society, serving as its recording secretary from 1931 to 1935 and its president from 1936 to 1938, and was editor of the Society's journal, Entomological News, from 1945 to 1967.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Rudolf Schmieder. Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence on general entomology with various colleagues; correspondence as editor of Entomological News; and correspondence related to his role as a member of the Thomas Say Foundation. Papers related to Scmeider's connections with the American Entomological Society, especially regarding those years when he was secretary or president of the Society include correspondence regarding corresponding members, recommendations for honors for life members, and other records of the society, including printed by-laws. Other materials in the collection include: a 1910 travel journal of Schmeider's trip to Europe; school papers; a 1916 yearbook from Central High School, Philadelphia; diplomas, certificates, and honorary memberships; and a family genealogy.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: American Entomological Society records and Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Entomology Department records.
